Master's Student at KIT & Fraunhofer IEE Â· Kassel, Germany

I'm a Master's student in Remote Sensing & Geoinformatics at Karlsruhe Institute of Technology (KIT), currently completing my thesis at Fraunhofer IEE on AI-based long-term correction of short-term wind measurements. My work sits at the crossroads of machine learning, renewable energy systems, and atmospheric science. Previously, I interned at Deutsche Wetterdienst and KIT's IMK institute, and worked as a software developer building ERP integrations with .NET Core and microservices at Inveon, Istanbul.
